etymologies: early 16th century: sandal from medieval Latin sandalum (based on Sanskrit candana) + wood

definitions: a widely cultivated Indian tree that yields fragrant timber and oil.
shortDefinitions: Indian tree that yields fragrant timber and oil

definitions: a perfume or incense derived from the sandalwood.
shortDefinitions: perfume or incense derived from of sandalwood

definitions: used in names of trees which yield timber similar to that of the sandalwood, e.g. red sandalwood.
shortDefinitions: used in names of trees which yield timber similar to that of sandalwood
